intro: Sparaxis grandiflora subsp. violacea, commonly known as the violet-veined spear百合, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features upright, grass-like foliage and produces striking, showy flowers in shades of violet and white. The plant blooms in late winter to early spring, making it a valuable addition to gardens in cooler climates. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, and is relatively drought-tolerant once established. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting, fragrant blooms.
